==New or changed features==
==New or changed features==
â
Some new features were announced at the "Back to the Mac" keynote in October 2010, and the Apple website was updated in February 2011 with more details. More features are expected to be revealed as the release date nears.
+
Some new features were announced at the "Back to the Mac" keynote in October 2010, and the Apple website was updated in February 2011 with more details. More features are expected to be revealed as the release date nears. Some people (cough cough me) want this sooooo baddddd... :D
â  
* [[Mac App Store]] â An application store built in the image of the iOS [[App Store]]. Like in iOS, it will provide ways for shoppers to discover apps, one-click installation of apps, and one-click updates of all or selected installed applications.<ref name=CNetVideo /><ref>[http://www.apple.com/mac/app-store Apple - App Store - Buy, download, and install apps made for Mac]</ref><ref name="appleinsider 90 days">{{cite web |url=http://www.appleinsider.com/articles/10/10/20/apples_new_mac_app_store_coming_to_snow_leopard_within_90_days.html |title=Apple's new Mac App Store coming to Snow Leopard within 90 days |author=AppleInsider Staff |date=20 October 2010 |work=AppleInsider.com |publisher= |accessdate=24 October 2010}}</ref> The Mac App Store was released for [[Mac OS X Snow Leopard]] on January 6, 2011 as it was bundled with the Mac OS X 10.6.6 update.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://support.apple.com/kb/dl1343|title=Mac OS X v10.6.6 Update|publisher=[[Apple Inc.]]|accessdate=2011-02-24}}</ref>
* [[Mac App Store]] â An application store built in the image of the iOS [[App Store]]. Like in iOS, it will provide ways for shoppers to discover apps, one-click installation of apps, and one-click updates of all or selected installed applications.<ref name=CNetVideo /><ref>[http://www.apple.com/mac/app-store Apple - App Store - Buy, download, and install apps made for Mac]</ref><ref name="appleinsider 90 days">{{cite web |url=http://www.appleinsider.com/articles/10/10/20/apples_new_mac_app_store_coming_to_snow_leopard_within_90_days.html |title=Apple's new Mac App Store coming to Snow Leopard within 90 days |author=AppleInsider Staff |date=20 October 2010 |work=AppleInsider.com |publisher= |accessdate=24 October 2010}}</ref> The Mac App Store was released for [[Mac OS X Snow Leopard]] on January 6, 2011 as it was bundled with the Mac OS X 10.6.6 update.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://support.apple.com/kb/dl1343|title=Mac OS X v10.6.6 Update|publisher=[[Apple Inc.]]|accessdate=2011-02-24}}</ref>
* [[Launchpad (Mac OS X)|Launchpad]] â An application launcher that displays an iOS-like icon grid of installed applications.<ref name="lionpage"/> It will feature the ability to make multiple pages and group apps into folders which function the same as folders in iOS.<ref name="lionpage"/>
* [[Launchpad (Mac OS X)|Launchpad]] â An application launcher that displays an iOS-like icon grid of installed applications.<ref name="lionpage"/> It will feature the ability to make multiple pages and group apps into folders which function the same as folders in iOS.<ref name="lionpage"/>
